title: Oil Sketch for "A Sunday on La Grande Jatte — 1884"

thumbnail.alt_text: Heavy daubs of pigment form a crowded scene of roughly defined, finely dressed individuals in a brightly color park along a riverbank.

description: This small oil on thin wood panel is one of over 20 painted studies Georges Seurat made for A Sunday on La Grande Jatte—1884 . Although at first glance its composition seems similar to the finished canvas, its 20 or more figures have little to do with the final version. The trio at right with an elderly seated figure, for example, was completely rethought in the completed work, where they are replaced by a man in a top hat and a woman walking a monkey on a leash. This ironic combination of grand solemnity and wry humor is totally absent from the sketch’s awkwardly positioned figures.
credit_line: Gift of Mary and Leigh Block
publication_history:
John Rewald, Post-Impressionism: From Van Gogh to Gauguin (New York: The Museum of Modern Art, 1956), p. 85 (ill.), as Study for La Grande Jatte, c. 1884.

Robert Herbert, “Seurat in Chicago and New York,” The Burlington Magazine, May 1958, pp. 151, 153 (pl. 11).

Henri Dorra and John Rewald, Seurat: l’oeuvre peint biographie et catalogue critique (Paris: Les Beaux –Arts, 1959), cat. 119 (ill.), as Vue générale avec groupement de personnages, étude pour ‘La Grande Jatte,’ 1884-85.

C. M. de Hauke, Seurat et son oeuvre (Paris: Gründ, 1961), no. 128 (ill.), as Petite esquisse.

André Chastel and Fiorella Minervino, L’opera completa di Seurat (Milano: Rizzoli, 1972), ill. 128, pl. 19A, as Gruppi di figure alla ‘Grande Jatte.’

The Burlington Magazine 976, v. 76 (July 1984), p. 464 (ill. 88).

Richard Brettell, French Impressionists (Chicago, 1987), pp. 89, 91 (ill.), 119.

James Wood, ed., Impressionism and Post-Impressionism in The Art Institute of Chicago (Chicago 2000), p. 78 (ill.), as Oil Sketch for La Grande Jatte, 1884.

The Age of Impressionism at the Art Institute of Chicago (New Haven and London, 2008), cat. 51, pp. 112-13 (ill.).

Bregje Gerritse and Jacquelyn N. Coutre, Van Gogh and the Avant-Garde: Along the Seine, exh. cat. (New Haven: Yale University Press, 2023), 106 fig. 73, 107, 198.
exhibition_history:
Munich, Kunstverein, Französische Künstler,  Sep. 1906, cat. 100; Frankfurt Kunstverein, Oct. 1906; Dresden Kunstverein, Nov. 1906; Galerie E. Arnold, Kalsruhe Kunstverein, Dec. 1906; Stuttgart Kunstverein, Jan. 1907.

Paris, Galerie Jacques Rodrigues-Henriqués, Quelques oeuvres échangées jadis entre eux,  May 17-June 3, 1938.

Art Institute of Chicago, Seurat: Paintings and Drawings, Jan. 16-Mar. 7, cat. 94 as Sketch for ‘La Grande Jatte’; New York, The Museum of Modern Art, Mar. 24 – May 11, 1958.

Washington, National Gallery of Art, 100 European Paintings and Drawings from the Collection of Mr. and Mrs. Leigh B. Block, May 4-June 11, 1967, cat. 21; Los  Angeles County Museum of Art, Sep. 21-Nov. 2, 1967.

Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, One Hundred European Paintings and Drawings from the Collection of Mr. and Mrs. Leigh B. Block, Feb. 2-Apr. 14, 1968, cat. 22 (ill.).

Paris, Galeries Nationales du Grand Palais, Seurat, 1859-1891, Apr. 9-Aug. 12, 1991; New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Sep. 24-Jan. 12, 1992, cat. 127, as Petite esquisse (Sketch with Many Figures).

Cologne, Wallraf-Richartz-Museum, Pointillismus, Sep. 6-Nov. 1997, cat. 132; Lausanne, Fondaton de l’Hermitage, Jan. 23-May 1998 [Cologne Only].

Art Institute of Chicago, Seurat and the Making of ‘La Grande Jatte,’ June 16-Sep. 19, 2004,  cat. 48, pp. 74 (color ill.), 75, 267 (color ill.), 274, as Sketch with Many Figures (study for La Grande Jatte), 1884.

Fort Worth, Tex., Kimbell Museum of Art, The Impressionists: Master Paintings from the Art Institute of Chicago, June 29–Nov. 2, 2008, cat. 51 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, Bridget Riley Drawings: From the Artist’s Studio, Sep. 17, 2022-Jan 16, 2023, not in cat.; Los Angeles,, Hammer Museum, Feb. 5-May 14, 2023; New York, Morgan Library and Museum, June 23-Oct. 8, 2023 [Chicago only].

Art Institute of Chicago, Van Gogh and the Avant-Garde: The Modern Landscape, May 14-Sep. 4, 2023, fig. 73; Amsterdam, Van gogh Museum, Van Gogh Along the Seine, Oct. 13-Jan. 14, 2024.
provenance_text: The artist (died 1891), Paris [panneau no. 87, posthumous inventory, dated May 3, 1891, reproduced in de Hauke 1961, v.1, 80]. Possibly by descent to the artist’s mother, Ernestine Faivre Seurat (died 1899). Maximilien Luce (died 1941), Paris [Herbert 1992, 129]; by descent to his son, Frédéric Luce, Paris, 1941 [this and the following according to correspondence from Claudine Godts, Wildenstein & Co. Inc., Oct. 14, 2021; copy in curatorial object file]; sold to Wildenstein and Co., Paris, May 1955 ; transferred to Wildenstein and Co., New York, Oct. 1955; sold to Leigh B. Block (died 1987) and Mary Lasker Block (died 1981), Chicago, Nov. 1955 [according to the above and correspondence from Susan Stein, Aug. 11, 2004; copy in curatorial object file]; bequeathed to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1981.

input: Oil Sketch for "A Sunday on La Grande Jatte — 1884"
